languages.text: "Из малых искажений Кредо рождаются большие, а из больших — ересь. Основа нашей веры — абсолютное доверие к пастырям, стоящим выше, и если их убеждения толкают их на смуту, они по умолчанию дурны. Но это не значит, что дурны проповедники, они могут просто заблуждаться. Отдайте их на перевоспитание святым отцам Экклезиархии, пусть узрят истину... и послужат гарантом, что их паства успокоится".

"Small deviances in the Creed beget large ones, and large ones beget heresy. Our faith is founded upon absolute trust in those above us, and if these people's beliefs push them toward dissent, then those beliefs have been wicked from the very beginning. But that does not necessarily make the preachers themselves wicked — perhaps simply misguided. We could pass them into the Ecclesiarchy's care for re-education so that they may see the truth... and it would also guarantee their flock's obedience."
languages.original_text: "Из малых искажений Кредо рождаются большие, а из больших — ересь. Основа нашей веры — абсолютное доверие к пастырям, стоящим выше, и если их убеждения толкают их на смуту, они по умолчанию дурны. Но это не значит, что дурны проповедники, они могут просто заблуждаться. Отдайте их на перевоспитание святым отцам Экклезиархии, пусть узрят истину... и послужат гарантом, что их паства успокоится".

traits.locale_text: "The small distortions of the Creed give birth to the big ones, and the big ones — to heresy. The basis of our beliefs is the absolute trust in the pastors above them, and if their beliefs push them to revolting, that means that they have been wicked from the very beginning. But it does not make the pastors wicked — they could simply have gotten misguided. Pass them into the Ecclesiarchy's care for re-education, so that they may see the truth... and guarantee their flock' obedience."

Pass them into the Ecclesiarchy's care for re-education, so that they may see the truth... and guarantee their flock' obedience."

But it does not make the priests wicked — they could simply have been misguided. Pass them into the Ecclesiarchy's care for re-education, so that they may see the truth... and guarantee their flocks' obedience."

languages.text: “信条上的些许偏差将会演变为更大的偏差，最终变成异端邪说。我们信仰的基础就是：绝对信任那些在我们之上的人。因此，如果他们的信仰驱使他们反抗，那只能意味着那些人的理念从一开始就是错的。不过，这不代表那些小型教派的牧师都是恶人，他们可能只是被误导了。把他们交给国教进行再教育吧，让他们重新看到真理……确保牧群服从命令。”
languages.original_text: "Small deviances in the Creed give birth to large ones, and the large ones — to heresy. The basis of our beliefs lies in the absolute trust of those above us, and if their beliefs push them toward revolt, that means that these tenants have been wicked from the very beginning. But it does not make the priests wicked — they could simply have been misguided. Pass them into the Ecclesiarchy's care for re-education, so that they may see the truth... and guarantee their flocks' obedience."

languages.text: «Las pequeñas divergencias en el Credo dan lugar a las grandes, y las grandes, a la herejía. La base de nuestras creencias reside en la confianza absoluta de los que están por encima de nosotros, y si sus creencias les empujan a la revuelta, eso significa que esos fieles han sido malvados desde el principio. Pero eso no convierte a los sacerdotes en malvados, simplemente podrían haber estado mal orientados. Pásalos al cuidado de la Eclesiarquía para su reeducación, para que puedan ver la verdad... y garantizar la obediencia de sus rebaños».
languages.original_text: "Small deviances in the Creed give birth to large ones, and the large ones — to heresy. The basis of our beliefs lies in the absolute trust of those above us, and if their beliefs push them toward revolt, that means that these tenants have been wicked from the very beginning. But it does not make the priests wicked — they could simply have been misguided. Pass them into the Ecclesiarchy's care for re-education, so that they may see the truth... and guarantee their flocks' obedience."

traits.locale_text: «Las pequeñas divergencias en el Credo dan lugar a las grandes, y las grandes, a la herejía. La base de nuestras creencias reside en la confianza absoluta de los que están por encima de nosotros, y si sus creencias les empujan a la revuelta, eso significa que esos fieles han sido malvados desde el principio. Pero eso no convierte a los sacerdotes en malvados, simplemente podrían haber estado mal orientados. Pásalos al cuidado de la Eclesiarquía para su reeducación, para que puedan ver la verdad... y garantizar la obediencia de sus rebaños».

languages.text: 「信条集での小さな逸脱は大きな逸脱を生み、そして大きな逸脱は...異端を生むものです。私たちの信念の礎は、上の者への絶対的な信頼にあります。もし彼らの信念が反乱へと後押しするのであれば、それは心を占めるものが最初から邪悪であったことを意味します。しかし、だからといって司祭たちが邪悪であるとは限りません...心得違いをしているだけかもしれませんから。再教育のため、彼らを帝国聖教会に入れ、真実を分からせてやり...民の服従を保証するのです」
languages.original_text: "Small deviances in the Creed give birth to large ones, and the large ones — to heresy. The basis of our beliefs lies in the absolute trust of those above us, and if their beliefs push them toward revolt, that means that these tenants have been wicked from the very beginning. But it does not make the priests wicked — they could simply have been misguided. Pass them into the Ecclesiarchy's care for re-education, so that they may see the truth... and guarantee their flocks' obedience."

languages.text: « Le moindre détournement du Crédo donne naissance à d'autres écarts plus importants et ces derniers, à des formes d'hérésie. Nos croyances reposent sur la confiance absolue envers nos supérieurs, alors si leurs croyances à eux les poussent à la révolte, c'est qu'ils étaient corrompus dès le début... mais cela ne rend pas les prêtres malveillants, ils peuvent tout simplement avoir été dupés. Envoyez-les dans des centres de rééducation de l'Ecclésiarchie, qu'ils puissent voir la vérité... et s'assurent de l'obéissance de leurs ouailles. »
languages.original_text: "Small deviances in the Creed give birth to large ones, and the large ones — to heresy. The basis of our beliefs lies in the absolute trust of those above us, and if their beliefs push them toward revolt, that means that these tenants have been wicked from the very beginning. But it does not make the priests wicked — they could simply have been misguided. Pass them into the Ecclesiarchy's care for re-education, so that they may see the truth... and guarantee their flocks' obedience."

Envoyez-les dans des centres de rééducation de l'Ecclésiarchie, qu'ils puissent voir la vérité... et s'assurent de l'obéissance de leurs ouailles. »

languages.text: "Kleine Abweichungen im Glauben führen zu größeren, und die größeren — zur Ketzerei. Die Basis unseres Glaubens liegt in dem absoluten Vertrauen in jene, die über uns stehen. Und wenn deren Glaube sie zur Revolte treibt, dann bedeutet das, dass diese Grundsätze von vornherein böse waren. Das macht aber die Priester nicht böse — sie sind vielleicht einfach fehlgeleitet. Übergebt sie der Obhut der Ekklesiarchie, damit sie umerzogen werden, damit sie die Wahrheit sehen ... und den Gehorsam ihrer Gemeinden gewährleisten."
languages.original_text: "Small deviances in the Creed give birth to large ones, and the large ones — to heresy. The basis of our beliefs lies in the absolute trust of those above us, and if their beliefs push them toward revolt, that means that these tenants have been wicked from the very beginning. But it does not make the priests wicked — they could simply have been misguided. Pass them into the Ecclesiarchy's care for re-education, so that they may see the truth... and guarantee their flocks' obedience."

languages.text: "İtikat'taki ufak sapkınlıklar, daha büyüklerini doğurdu ve büyükleri de... Kâfirliğe yol açtı. İnançlarımızın temelinde üstlerimize karşı mutlak güven yatar. Eğer ki inançları onları isyana ittiyse bu da mutasarrıfların en başından beri günahkâr oldukları manasına gelir. Fakat bu, rahipleri günahkârdan ziyade yanlış yönlendirilmiş kılar. Yeniden eğitilmeleri için onları Ekleşiarşi'ye emanet edin ki hakikati görebilsinler ve... Cemaatlerinin itaatkârlığı garantilensin."
languages.original_text: "Small deviances in the Creed give birth to large ones, and the large ones — to heresy. The basis of our beliefs lies in the absolute trust of those above us, and if their beliefs push them toward revolt, that means that these tenants have been wicked from the very beginning. But it does not make the priests wicked — they could simply have been misguided. Pass them into the Ecclesiarchy's care for re-education, so that they may see the truth... and guarantee their flocks' obedience."
